title: Fix round timer not resetting to 3s on round start
description:
The round timer (responseTimeLimit) is not being reset to 3s when transitioning from TIMEOUT_INTERMISSION to WAITING_INPUT state. After a correct guess, the timer should pause and the orchestrator should advance to the next round after X seconds (autoAdvanceSpeed). On the next round (when transitioning from intermission to waiting_input), the timer should be reset to 3s (or the configured responseTimeLimit).

Current behavior:
- Round timer continues from where it left off instead of resetting to 3s
- Timer does not pause on correct guess

Expected behavior:
- Round timer resets to responseTimeLimit (3s default) ONLY when transitioning from TIMEOUT_INTERMISSION to WAITING_INPUT
- Timer pauses when correct guess is made (entering TIMEOUT_INTERMISSION)
- After autoAdvanceSpeed delay, advance to next round with fresh timer

Implementation approach:
- Need a separate roundTimer invoked service (similar to gameTimer)
- WAITING_INPUT state entry (from TIMEOUT_INTERMISSION) should reset and start the round timer
- CORRECT_GUESS should pause the round timer
- TIMEOUT_INTERMISSION should keep round timer paused
- Timer should send TIMEOUT event when it reaches 0 (for countdown) or limit (for countup)
notes: Additional fix: Resolved timer reset on resume. Tests added in roundTimer.test.ts covering reset, pause/resume, timeout, and incorrect guess behaviors. All 14 tests passing.

title: Fix Sandbox game timer not decrementing from 1m
description:
In Sandbox mode, the session timer (sessionDuration) should count down from the configured time limit (e.g., 1 minute). Currently, the timer is not decrementing and stays at the initial value.

Current behavior:
- Session timer displays initial time (60s) but never decrements
- Game never completes when timer reaches 0

Expected behavior:
- Session timer should count down from configured sessionDuration
- When timer reaches 0, send TIMEOUT event to trigger session completion
- Timer should pause/resume correctly with game pause/resume
- Timer should display remaining time in UI components

Implementation approach:
- gameTimer invoked service needs to be configured with countdown direction for Sandbox mode
- Need to pass correct timerConfig to machine actor based on game mode
- Sandbox mode should set: { initialTime: sessionDuration, direction: 'down' }
- Other modes should use: { initialTime: 0, direction: 'up' }
- Timer service should emit TIMEOUT event when countdown reaches 0

notes: Fixed! The issue was not just CSS colors - there was a logic bug. The code was immediately validating notes when clicked and showing green/red, instead of showing gray until submit. Fixed handleNoteSelection to only toggle selection without validation, and handleSubmitAnswer to do the actual validation. Now clicking shows gray, submit shows green/yellow/red. All 641 tests passing (1 pre-existing failure unrelated).

title: Chord Training - Implement color feedback after submit

Requirements:
- Green: Note is clicked AND note is in the chord (correct)
- Yellow: Note is NOT clicked AND note IS in the chord (missed it)
- Red: Note is clicked but NOT in the chord (wrong)
- Feedback persists until Next Chord is clicked
- Use success/dimmed/error highlight types from NoteHighlightType

- Clear highlights when advancing to next round

title: Fix timeout events not updating guess history in chord modes
description:
When the round timer expires in Chord Training or Chord Identification modes, the timeout should count as an incorrect guess and be added to the ChordGuessHistory component. Currently, timeout events advance to the next round but don't update the guess history.

Expected behavior:
- When round timer reaches 0, add a failed attempt to guessHistory with 0% accuracy
- Display a  icon in the ChordGuessHistory component
- Should work for both Chord Training and Chord Identification modes

Current behavior:
- Timeout advances to next round
- No entry is added to guess history
- User can't see that a timeout occurred in their history

Technical notes:
- GameOrchestrator.handleTimeout() is being called (line 1452)
- It calls gameState.handleIncorrectGuess() (line 775)
- But the guess history is not being updated in the UI
- Console logs in handleIncorrectGuess should help debug if the method is being called

Files involved:
- src/game/GameOrchestrator.ts (timeout detection and handling)
- src/game/SingleChordGameState.tsx (handleIncorrectGuess method)
- src/game/ChordIdentificationGameState.tsx (handleIncorrectGuess method)
- src/game/strategies/ChordTrainingStrategy.ts (context.note was added)
